meanings.definition: To give up or surrender control or possession of something.
meanings.sent1: She was ceding her favorite toy to her little sister.
meanings.sent2: The country was ceding some of its land to its neighbor.
meanings.sent3: After much negotiation, he reluctantly started ceding control of the project to his colleague.
meanings.sent4: The company was ceding its market share to the new competitor.
meanings.sent5: The decision to cede control of the remote control to her brother was a tough one.

meanings.definition: To transfer or convey something to another person or entity.
meanings.sent1: He was ceding his responsibilities to his assistant before going on vacation.
meanings.sent2: The deed was ceded to the new owner after the sale was finalized.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to be ceding its territory to the new stray cat in the neighborhood.
meanings.sent4: The artist was ceding his creative vision to the director of the film.
meanings.sent5: The decision to cede control of the company to his daughter was a strategic move.
